newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Afghan rebels claim taking main govt airbase.
newsitem.headline: Afghan rebels claim taking main govt airbase.

text.p: Afghanistan's rebel Taleban Islamic militia captured the government's main airbase at Bagram, north of the capital Kabul, on Thursday night, Taleban sources in Pakistan said.
The sources, quoted by the Pakistan-based Afghan Islamic Press (AIP) service, said troops loyal to President Burhanuddin Rabbani were fleeing northwards.
The militia forces also captured Kabul's diplomatic Wazir Akbar Khan district at night and were battling government troops near the presidential palace in the centre of the capital.
Earlier, Taleban sources in Pakistan said the militia had captured Kabul's disused Khwaja Rawash airport and the Soviet-built Microrayon housing district.
